issue.title: [Keyboard Navigation-Name menu-Text filter] 'Text filter' popup is not getting by 'Esc' key under 'Name' dialog.

labels.name: :bug: bug
labels.description: Any issue that describes a bug

labels.name: :white_check_mark: status: resolved
labels.description: Applies to issues that have pending PRs resolving them, or PRs that have already merged.

issue.body:
User Experience:
The "Esc" key is a common and expected method to close modals, and its absence can hinder their ability to move through the interface. This can interrupt the natural flow of navigation and interaction, making the experience more cumbersome.


'Text filter' popup is not getting closed by 'Esc' key under 'Name' dialog.
Observation: When the keyboard focus lands on 'text filter' control and after invoking it popup appears and 
after pressing 'esc' key it is not getting closed the popup and by pressing shift + tab key it is moving to 'apply' button.

source link: [Excel Style Filtering in Angular Data Grid- Ignite UI for Angular (infragistics.com)](https://www.infragistics.com/products/ignite-ui-angular/angular/components/grid/excel-style-filtering)

comment.body: This is getting fixed alongside https://github.com/IgniteUI/igniteui-angular/issues/13522 so please check my  answer for that item.

issue.title: [Screen Reader] Screen reader does not announce search results information by entering 'valid/invalid' data under 'Name' dialog.

labels.name: :white_check_mark: status: resolved
labels.description: Applies to issues that have pending PRs resolving them, or PRs that have already merged.

issue.body:
Screen reader users rely on auditory feedback to understand the outcome of their actions. If search results are not announced, users won't know whether their search query was successful or if there were any relevant matches.

Screen reader does not announce search results information by entering 'valid/invalid' data under 'Name' dialog.
NVDA remain silent.

Expected Result:

Screen reader should announce search results information by entering 'valid/invalid' data under 'Name' dialog.

source link: [Excel Style Filtering in Angular Data Grid- Ignite UI for Angular (infragistics.com)](https://www.infragistics.com/products/ignite-ui-angular/angular/components/grid/excel-style-filtering)

comment.body: There is a proposed fix but it didn't pass initial reviews so we are still discussing how best to achieve this functionality . We'll continue working on this item next sprint. The earlies you could expect a fix is on November 6

issue.title: [Keyboard Navigation>] Keyboard focus is not in logical order under 'Text filter' popup, while navigating using 'tab key.

labels.name: :bug: bug
labels.description: Any issue that describes a bug

labels.name: :white_check_mark: status: resolved
labels.description: Applies to issues that have pending PRs resolving them, or PRs that have already merged.

issue.body:
Keyboard focus is not going in logical order for Product Name header filter. By moving through tab key inside the text filter the focus is not going in logical order.

Shift + Tab Key - going directly to Apply button but require going on text filter button.

source link- [Excel Style Filtering in Angular Data Grid- Ignite UI for Angular (infragistics.com)](https://www.infragistics.com/products/ignite-ui-angular/angular/components/grid/excel-style-filtering)

Repo Step:

1. Launch the above link.
2. Go to Product Name Header Filter.
3. Navigate to the 'text filter' button.
4. Verify whether keyboard focus is not in logical order under 'Text filter' popup or not.

Actual Result:
Keyboard focus is not in logical order under 'Text filter' popup, while navigating using tab key.
Observation: After pressing 'Shit + tab' key on contain menu keyboard focus moves to 'apply' button and again pressing 'shift + tab' its moves 'cancel 'button.
Expected Result:
Keyboard focus should be in logical order under 'Text filter' popup, while navigating using tab key.
Ex: Keyboard focus should move back to 'text filter' control while navigating using 'shift + tab' key.

comment.body: Now have in mind that by ARIA spec the secondary dropdown is actually part of the Text Filter component and they work as a single item in terms of the page's tab sequence. So users need to open the Text Filter menu with Enter then navigate it using the arrow keys, not with Tab. Tab and Shift+Tab would only move through the items siblings to Text Filter.

issue.title: Stale grid.groupsRecords on groupingDone

labels.name: :bug: bug
labels.description: Any issue that describes a bug

labels.name: :white_check_mark: status: resolved
labels.description: Applies to issues that have pending PRs resolving them, or PRs that have already merged.

issue.body:
## Description  
Hi, this.grid.groupsRecords is not up to date when this.grid.groupingDone emits. I expected the groupsRecords to be grouped by all expressions in groupingDone's IGroupingDoneEventArgs event, but it is stale. For example if grouped by four expressions and I add a fifth grouping, the state of groupsRecords after groupingDone is as if I only have four expressions, not five. Perhaps I am using the wrong callback? Thanks

 * igniteui-angular version: 15.1.13
 * browser: Chrome Version 115.0.5790.110 (Official Build) unknown (64-bit)
